HOW_TO_CONTENT.heading: Så här ändrar du storlek på en bild
steps: Klicka på Välj fil för att ladda upp bilden från enheten eller klicka på rullgardinsknappen för att ladda upp från Dropbox eller Google Drive.
Justera bildens mått och format enligt önskade specifikationer.
Klicka på Förhandsgranska om du vill se ändringarna du har gjort.
Spara ändringarna genom att klicka på knappen Spara ändringar.
Klicka på knappen Hämta om du vill hämta den skalade bilden.

FAQ.question: Is it possible to resize (convert, optimize) many images at the same time by using resizer image to 2x2 dimensions tool?
FAQ.answer: When utilising the resizer image to 2x2 dimensions tool, several images cannot be resized at the same time. In such situations, a few methods can be used. For example, in Photoshop, you can use the Image Processor dialogue box to resize several images at once. Select Tools > Adjust Size, and choose the size you want for all images. You can also change the percentage by entering a lower or higher value. For example, you can reduce an image by choosing a percentage of less than 100 and enlarge it by choosing a higher value.Resizing an image can also be done on a multi-threaded computer. This method allows you to resize multiple images at once, but it is not recommended for a web page. If you need to resize multiple images, use the resize command. It will take much less time than using the resize command individually. And once you've set it up, you can even batch resize your files at once.

FAQ.question: When it comes to zooming and resizing, what's the difference? Zooming is done with the resizer image to 2x2 dimensions tool?

FAQ.question: What's the difference between scaling and resizing? The resizer image to 2x2 dimensions tool is used to perform the scaling?
FAQ.answer: The biggest difference between scaling and resizing lies in the way that the resolution of the image is altered. While resizing involves a more exact pixel size, scaling is a less exact process. In this case, the original image must be multiples of the final size, which can result in a pixelated effect. This is a key feature to consider when resizing an image. Using the resizer image to 2x2 dimensions tool, we can only resize images in inches; it is not useful for scaling.
